page.title: 03BO'NESS RECREATION SURVEY
page.content:
How the Recreation Centre is used.
On 14th June 1985 our class kept a tally of persons using the centre between 9.00am and 9.00pm. We found that 1023 people used it in that time. We did a survey every ten minutes. 73 people took part in it. We found out that most of those surveyed used it for swimming (46) and badminton and squash proved a second popular choice. It was also used for snooker, running, multi-gym, social activities, weight training, fencing, life saving, and the cafe facilities. The dog obediency class was very popular. The evening was the busiest time. The majority of people using the centre lived locally, about ten minutes on average away from it. We discovered that it was greatly used by the people of Bo'ness who were glad it had been built in their town.
